Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise.”
Reviews.Author: Joshiep123
Reviews.Content: Great Location. You can walk to at least 15 restaurants in 5 mins. The breakfast there was great. The staff was very friendly. Only problem and it's a small one was the shower was a little outdated this place is worth every Pennie.

Reviews.Title: “Can be overly $$, but its nice with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: travelerbrian
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business. Very nice hotel with tons of food and shopping within walking distance. I will stay here whenever possible!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: IMEOW
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night earlier this month on our return trip from Myrtle Beach, SC. Upon check-in, I found the gentleman at the front desk was extremely nice and very welcoming. After completing the usual check-in, I was surprised when he handed me a paper and asked me to sign it explaining that they have no tolerance for disturbances. LOVED IT! I cannot tell you how many hotels I have stayed in that I was kept awake by doors slamming, people talking & yelling and kids running up & down the hallways at all hours of the night making noise. Every hotel should follow suit! Our room was clean, clean, clean! Never been disappointed yet with a Hampton Inn, however, this one was a step above. Our king bed was so comfortable that I did not want to leave in the morning. Seeing a soap dish in the bathroom made my day! It is one of my biggest pet peeves to stay somewhere and have the little bar of handsoap slide all over the vanity - yuck! Great water pressure in the shower too! The lobby & breakfast area are tastefully decorated with a retro-mod feel. Another nice touch here! Our breakfast ladies, Kathy & Brittany were superb! Our daughter has life threatening food allergies and both of these ladies went above & beyond to make sure she could safely eat some of the items on the hot breakfast portion. Both of these ladies exemplified service with a smile. I would not hesitate to stay here again and would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location!”
Reviews.Author: vak9girl74
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location - close to shopping, food and entertainment! The staff at the desk were very helpful. I did have an issue with my room - it smelled musty due to the a/c unit. I called the desk and was moved immediately to another room. It wasn't fresh smelling but it got better as the a/c started running. The room was a good size, with a sofa in the sitting area. The internet was free and fast and the bed was very comfortable. The food in the lobby was great and so was the customer service. I believe with a little updating, it would be an amazing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was wonderful! Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Funtsie
Reviews.Content: 49 nurses, for a reunion of Franklin Square Nurses Association, and the hotel was so helpful and nice. We could not ask for more. Thanks to all the staff who went out of their way to help us, clean rooms, fresh breakfast. Thank you!!!!!! Last memory the man at the desk asked us about our reunion and wished us safe travel. Thank that man ............we left 9/13/2010 @ 9am!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: traveleron95
Reviews.Content: Rude, threatening, and frankly crazy night desk staff "Angie," who calls on bouncer-like other staff to support her craziness. Do not stay at this hotel if you value your safety, especially if you are are woman. I was a tired, professional, polite, middle-aged woman driver who pulled off Route 95 when driving, tired, late on a Sunday night, to get a room to sleep the rest of the night before continuing my travel. I was denied an available room mid check-in by extremely rude staff. Something very strange was going on in this hotel before I even walked in the door. Note to self: if you walk into an establishment and the staff angrily and irritatingly asks what they can do for you, turn around and walk out immediately, no matter how tired you are...they only get angrier from there once they've a "guest" upon which to take out whatever's bugging them. Truly "incredible" staff - never seen the like before, hope to never encounter such again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: dorilee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near Baltimore, and is adjacent to the White Marsh shopping center. It's easy to get to and is convenient for all travelers. The manager, Ms. Taylor, greeted us warmly and welcomed us back to the motel. She had helped me with our reservation, and Hilton is lucky to have her in their employ. The room was comfortable and quiet. When we were ready for dinner, the hotel "trolley" took us to the restaurant and brought us back after dinner. How nice that was after a long day of driving! The restaurant had been "suggested" by the staff, and was lovely. The breakfast area was well equipped and offered a large variety, from cereals to omlettes to waffles and everything in between. The breakfast staff made sure that guests had everything they needed. We would gladly return to this Hampton Inn. The staff and the hotel were great.

Reviews.Title: “I can't say enough good things”
Reviews.Author: MDlover
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter, her fiancee and I stayed here for the weekend of April 24th for some pre wedding activities and visiting family. There is another suite hotel in the area which was approx $100 more a night. This was perfect! We had the queen suite. The rooms were very clean. There is a sink area in the living area with mirror and overhead light, which allows someone to get ready while another is in the bathroom. There are two flat screen TVs, one in the living area, one in the bedroom. The bed was very comfortable. Even the sleep sofa was comfortable. The wireless internet came in handy also. The hot breakfast was decent, even more so since it's included in the room cost. There is always hot fresh coffee in the lobby and fresh fruit, no cost. There is even a laundry available to guests, no cost. The staff was excellent!!! Very kind, thoughtful and helpful. We needed a cork screw, we called the front desk to ask if they had one. One was delivered and he even offered to show us how to use it or even open the bottle for us. They also quickly and with a smile delivered extra pillows. The location was very convenient. You can walk to The Avenue where there are shops and restaurants. Ikea is within walking distance. The mall is within walking distance, too, even though a little longer walk.... across the large mall parking lot. But the weather was excellent, so we chose to walk and enjoy the warmth and sunshine. It's convenient to the Beltway, 695, and to I-95. They are in the process of building a fire pit out back, near the pool. And they are presently doing some redecorating of the lobby area. I highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucky52
Reviews.Content: I stay here on every visit to Baltimore - efficient and friendly staff, meticulous housekeeping, good breakfast. Best kept secret, the suites, which are only a few dollars more if you have a AARP or AAA discount - lots of room if you're in town for a long visit. Also very convenient to all the interstates and there is "The Avenue" within a short walk across the street: Starbucks, two nice local restaurants (Red Brick Station and Della Rosa's), movies and two hair salons! Only negative, it can get noisy if you are in a room on the first floor during baseball season when out of town fans crowd the hotel - so, stay on an upper floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a Night on the Road”
Reviews.Author: kjd1978
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this facility twice, both spur of the moment on trips involving I95. I have been completely satisfied both times. The facility is a little tricky to get to off the highway, but not too hard because the signage is good and there are 3 places with nice big signs right beside each other. There are restaurants within walking distance and the beds are awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Believe in the Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: 3Free
Reviews.Content: Me and my lady stayed at the Hampton Inn on the weekend of March 21-24. This was our second stay and we loved it so much that we are naming our first son Hampton. Just kidding, but the stay was comfortable and, most importantly, the feather top bed was awesome... This is a key point because by contrast, we were in a suite across the street at the Hilton and their bed felt like it was built on a slab of marble. It literally felt like we were sleeping on a very comfortable, sleeping bag-- on our kitchen floor.. That was the only sticking point but a huge deterrence for our stay at the Hilton. So we switched our reservation midway and went to the Hampton Inn across the street. And you know what, we were told that Hilton employees stayed there all the time. We even saw an off-duty Hilton employee who had stayed there! All in all, although the Hampton Inn is owned by the Hilton. Do not stay at the Hilton because of its brand name (My girlfriend calls me a brand name groupie).. Stay at the Hampton Inn...Believe in the Hampton Inn...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...”
Reviews.Author: LimeGuy
Reviews.Content: we needed a hotel to sleep in while traveling on 95 north this weekend. I made it to Baltimore and that was it. I saw the Hampton from the highway and got off. The Hilton Gardens Inn and the Hampton are side by side in the White Marsh Town Center. The check in was fine considering that we did not have a reservation and it was midnight. Room was spacious and clean. Bathroom was clean. Breakfast the next day was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Stayable hotel, best feature = local shopping”
Reviews.Author: RoamingRiddhi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the White Marsh Hampton Inn for 3 nights beginning on Sept. 20th, 2007. Pros: The bedding was very soft, very close to tonnes of restaurants, great shopping ("The Avenue" with lots of yuppie shops like Pier One, Borders, terrific restautants), breakfast staff were warm and earnest. Room had additional cable channels, such as HGTV. Cons: The hotel is old, worn carpets in the hallways, and the room amneties seem dated. Not that convenient to downtown Baltimore (about 30 minutes at a minimum), plus you have to pay a $2 toll each way, which got a bit tiring after the tenth time. Pool closed after Labour Day (not advertised). Room lacked fridge & microwave. All in all, it was OK, but we stayed at the H.I in Frederick.Ft. Detrick one night which was superior (see review). For my money ($150 / night) I would probably stay at one of the BWI airports if visiting Baltimore, since the price was cheaper and it was closer to Baltimore. The breakfast ladies really are lovely though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: msar1076
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in August. We were given a room on the second floor. A corner room across from the stairs. Because of that our room was larger than the standard room. The beds were extremely comfortable, the room was clean. It was a bit noisey because we faced the interstate. Maybe if you requested a room in the front you wouldn't hear road noise. The pool was okay. The free breakfast was good. Plenty of choices. The area around the hotel had plenty of restaurants and shopping. Overall a nice, safe place to stay outside the hustle and bustle of Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Convenient to Canden Yards”
Reviews.Author: Msia52
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we were in town for the Red Sox. This place was about a 25 minute drive to Camden Yards. It is easy to get to the highway from this hotel and there is a $2.00 toll on your way to Camden. The hotel staff were the friendliest group of people I have ever met while staying at a hotel. The breakfast ladies were fantastic. There was a very nice complimentary breakfast every morning. The rooms were a bit small but we didn't spend a whole lot of time there. My sister had an end room and they were considerably bigger than the room I had. The pool was small but the kids enjoyed it. The exercise room is adequate. I also used the computer and internet access was quick and easy. The do have complimentary Internet access codes if you have a laptop. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel and highly recommend it. Across the street is a big mall with several restaurants. The hotel runs a complimentary shuttle but we didn't have the time for it. It was nice to get out of downtown Baltimore and back to this hotel in Whitemarsh. The inner harbor is nice but crowded and expensive to eat at a decent restaurant. There are so many choices around this hotel in Whitemarsh. Everytime we asked for directions around Camden Yards, we were to told that we would be safe if we stayed around this area, street, etc. After about the sixth time with that comment, it made us wonder what the area was like and why each person commented on safety. It didn't feel unsafe but it was nice to get back to the Hampton Inn. It was relaxing, and there were lots of options to do other things beside stay in one area because of safety concerns. This hotel is a gem and we would stay here again if we have the need for a hotel in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel outside Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Jenlori14
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel that is about a half hour away from the Baltimore attractions. We are a family of four and felt the room was a little too small. If you are a large group (over 3 people) stay in the Residence Inn. It is about two minutes from the Hampton Inn and much nicer. Unfortunately, the NY Yankees were in town and all of the hotels were sold out, so we couldn't switch. The bathroom had very little space to keep your toiletries. Aside from that the beds were very comfortable and the staff were very accommodating. There was complimentary breakfast every morning which consisted of cereal, bagels, toast, donuts, biscuits and one hot breakfast item. The orange juice was not really juice (possibly Tang or Orange Kool-Aid). However, they also had apple and cranberry juice which tasted real. We didn't use the outdoor pool but it looked ok and there was a lifeguard on duty. If you go to the Inner Harbor do not eat at any of the chain restaurants (ex. California Pizza Kitchen, Houlihans, Cheesecake Factory) they are understaffed and the portion size is worse than other locations. Do yourself a favor and eat at the mall across the street from the hotel. They are less crowded and the food is good. There are about 7-8 restaurants there including TGI Fridays, Chilis and Don Pablos as well as small local eateries.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent quality from people who care”
Reviews.Author: BlitzkriegTrip
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed here numerous times while visiting me at Johns Hopkins over the past four years (I sleep over as well as I never pass up a stay at this hotel!) White Marsh is about a 20 minute drive to downtown Baltimore, but an easy one that is very accessible from all points of travel. The hotel is located across from a huge conglomeration of shops and malls- it has your typical mall with Macy's, etc., as well as a street known as "The Avenue" with various boutiques and eateries. Numerous restaurants and establishments (Bertuccis, Ballys Gym, Red Lobster) are scattered around the outskirts. A large Ikea is right there and Target and Wal-Mart as well. If you need something, from craft supplies to a fancy dress, you can find it right next door. The hotel even has a trolley (or shuttle van for larger groups) that will drive you to The Avenue whenever you want- and pick you up! Even though it's right across the street, it's nice to not worry about parking and to have the ability to all kick back and enjoy a cocktail or two! The hotel managers are great- even better are the women who serve up fabulous free (hot!) breakfasts every morning. There are the standard cereals and pastries and yogurts, but they have great build- your- own biscuits with eggs, sausage, and bacon which are perfect for filling up before a long day of traveling. If you are leaving early or can't make breakfast, the staff is more than happy to make a bag breakfast for you. On top of this, every evening they have warm gooey chocolate chip cookies available as well as coffee, tea and hot chocolate. The lobby/dining area is ample with a good television and they have a wonderful internet room where you can use the computer, printer, and various office supplies for FREE! Such a handy tool if you're traveling without your laptop. The rooms have the most gorgeous and plush white comforters and different thickness pillows (all labeled). The facility also has a very small workout room (try the free entry offered with your room to Ballys Fitness instead which is right next door!) There is also a small pool out back (only caveat- the beautiful trees sheltering the water have crazy fabric eating sap, so watch out!) My family never hesitates when deciding where to stay when coming up for a visit. The Hampton Inn at White Marsh is a no- brainer for people who want a hassle- free stay- be it a night stop on a long journey or a prolonged visit to the Baltimore region. On your way out, be sure to read the guest book in the lobby which displays countless letters of gratitude from past visitors.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to spend the night”
Reviews.Author: tymelyron
Reviews.Content: My sons and I stayed here this past Saturday night after an Orioles game; it is convenient to get to, about a 15-20 minute drive from the Inner Harbor and 2 minutes off the White Marsh exit. The hotel is located near the White Marsh mall, with lots of stores and restaurants. The Hilton Garden Inn is also next door. The Hampton Inn is a four story, modern hotel with a small outdoor pool and very small fitness center (1 treadmill and 2 bikes). Complimentary access to the Bally FItness Center next door was offered though. The rooms were clean, as were the bathrooms, and the beds and linens seemed new. The beds were very comfortable, with a pull out sofa in the room as well. The air conditioner was slightly noisy, as was highway I-95 nearby, but not unbearable. (A room facing the front might be a bit quieter). The carpet in the hallways looked a little worn, but the hotel generally appears well maintained. A business center with access to fax and computer is just off the lobby, and the free breakfast was impressive (hot eggs and sausage, donuts, bagels, muffins, cereal, yogurt, juices, etc.) With reasonable room rates, the Hampton can be recommended for a Baltimore stay to avoid the often overpriced and undermaintained downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff at a hotel”
Reviews.Author: babbles
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton Inn at White Marsh for 17 days on business. I have never been treated so well by the staff at any hotel and I stay at a lot of them. The front desk staff was great, the morning breakfast girls were great. That would be Miss May, Tammy and Cathy. Just tell them what you like and they will have it waiting for you. If you miss the managers reception on Wed. nights tell the front desk staff and they will save something for you. That is every Wed. night, free food, beer, soda. Also if you need to do laundry they have a washer and dryer there for guests to use at NO CHARGE and they even give you the soap and bounce to use FREE. The place is clean and very home friendly. They have an office space set up for you to use also. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay for Orioles Game”
Reviews.Author: feline1986
Reviews.Content: My family just spent the weekend at this Hampton Inn and it was great. Nice and clean and comfy with a tasty free breakfast each day. The TV in the lobby was perfect for watching the game we didn't have tickets to, in the big comfy sofas. Coffee is available in the lobby at all times which was appreciated. Within walking distance is a nice shopping and dining area which is also accessable by free trolley provided by the hotel. On game day it was a very quick and easy drive right into the inner harbor. After the game at Camden Yards, we skipped the busy restaurants right outside the ballpark and opted to head back to the Hampton Inn to relax and have a nice dinner in the Bayou Cafe right across the street. Easy access to the highway and plenty of free parking, free breakfast, and great nightly rate make this my first choice of places to stay in the Baltimore area.

HotelInfo.Name: Hampton Inn Baltimore / White Marsh
HotelInfo.Address: 8225 Town Center Dr., Baltimore, MD 21236
